articles.headline: An Easy Way to Back Up, but It Costs
articles.snippet: Are your noncorporate drives increasingly stuffed with data and not backed up? Drobo offers two systems intended to save all your files when drive death occurs.
articles.abstract: Are your noncorporate drives increasingly stuffed with data and not backed up? Drobo offers two systems intended to save all your files when drive death occurs.
articles.lead_paragraph: Hold up your right hand, look this page straight in the eye, and answer truthfully: At this moment, is your computer completely backed up?

articles.headline: A New Painkiller Crackdown Targets Drug Distributors
articles.snippet: In a new approach to combating prescription painkiller abuse, the federal government is focusing on the middlemen between drug makers and the doctors and pharmacies that dispense drugs.
articles.abstract: In a new approach to combating prescription painkiller abuse, the federal government is focusing on the middlemen between drug makers and the doctors and pharmacies that dispense drugs.
articles.lead_paragraph: A local druggist in Newport Beach, Calif., never expected that the federal government’s recent crackdown on distributors of prescription painkillers would ensnare him.

articles.headline: Push for Leniency as an Ex-Goldman Director Faces Sentencing
articles.snippet: Rajat K. Gupta, who has been convicted of insider trading, has asked a judge for a lenient sentence that would send him to Rwanda to perform humanitarian work rather than spending 8 to 10 years in prison.
articles.abstract: Rajat K. Gupta, who has been convicted of insider trading, has asked a judge for a lenient sentence that would send him to Rwanda to perform humanitarian work rather than spending 8 to 10 years in prison.
articles.lead_paragraph: Federal prosecutors want Rajat K. Gupta, once one of the world’s most prominent businessmen, to spend as much as 10 years in prison for insider trading.

articles.headline: Colombia Tries Again to End Drug-Fed War
articles.snippet: For the first time in a decade, rebels and the government of Colombia came together with the goal of ending the longest-running war in the Western Hemisphere.
articles.abstract: For the first time in a decade, rebels and the government of Colombia came together with the goal of ending the longest-running war in the Western Hemisphere.
articles.lead_paragraph: EL HORNO, Colombia — For the first time in a decade, rebels and the government of Colombia came together for formal peace talks on Wednesday, with the goal of ending the longest-running war in the Western Hemisphere — nearly 50 years old and counting.

articles.headline: With a New Menu and a Makeover, a Promise to Keep Going
articles.snippet: One constant in a struggling city like Elyria, Ohio, is the shared determination to make it through this day and into the next.
articles.abstract: One constant in a struggling city like Elyria, Ohio, is the shared determination to make it through this day and into the next.

articles.headline: Citi’s Chairman Steps Up to a Decisive Role
articles.snippet: Michael O’Neill is one of a new generation of board members unwilling to cede too much power to chief executives.
articles.abstract: Michael O’Neill is one of a new generation of board members unwilling to cede too much power to chief executives.
articles.lead_paragraph: When Michael E. O’Neill became chairman of Citigroup earlier this year, he dug into the sprawling bank by visiting a number of its trading floors and taking a detailed look at its business lines.
articles.byline: By Susanne Craig and Jessica Silver-Greenberg

articles.headline: Denial Is Slipping Away as War Arrives in Damascus
articles.snippet: As his troops battled insurgents all around the country, Bashar al-Assad was determined that in Damascus, at least, he would preserve an air of normalcy, but such illusions are no longer possible.
articles.abstract: As his troops battled insurgents all around the country, Bashar al-Assad was determined that in Damascus, at least, he would preserve an air of normalcy, but such illusions are no longer possible.
articles.lead_paragraph: DAMASCUS, Syria — Rifa was growing frantic. Her husband had called to say that he and her brother were stuck on their way home from work outside the Syrian capital, normally a 25-minute drive. There was fighting in a northern suburb, he said, and traffic was frozen.

articles.headline: Lapses at Big Drug Factories Add to Shortages and Danger
articles.snippet: Government warnings have led to plant overhauls, but drug shortages have often been the result.
articles.abstract: Government warnings have led to plant overhauls, but drug shortages have often been the result.
articles.lead_paragraph: Weevils floating in vials of heparin. Morphine cartridges that contain up to twice the labeled dose. Manufacturing plants with rusty tools, mold in production areas and — in one memorable case — a barrel of urine.

articles.headline: Rival Campaigns Intently Pursue Votes of Women
articles.snippet: With Election Day looming, the push for votes is coming down not only to a state-by-state fight, but also to one for the allegiance of vital demographic groups, chief among them undecided women.
articles.abstract: With Election Day looming, the push for votes is coming down not only to a state-by-state fight, but also to one for the allegiance of vital demographic groups, chief among them undecided women.
articles.lead_paragraph: Shortly after the combative presidential debate on Tuesday, Mitt Romney’s campaign began running a striking new commercial that uses a former Obama supporter to contest the notion that Mr. Romney’s positions on abortion and contraception are “extreme.”
articles.byline: By Jim Rutenberg and Jeremy W. Peters

articles.headline: Buy Reviews on Yelp, Get Black Mark
articles.snippet: The guide to finding businesses or restaurants is working to end inaccurate listings.
articles.abstract: The guide to finding businesses or restaurants is working to end inaccurate listings.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — Businesses caught soliciting favorable reviews are increasingly running the risk of getting slapped with a badge of shame.

articles.headline: At Newsweek, Ending Print and a Blend of Two Styles
articles.snippet: Newsweek will publish its final print magazine on Dec. 31 and begin an all-digital format, it announced Thursday.
articles.abstract: Newsweek will publish its final print magazine on Dec. 31 and begin an all-digital format, it announced Thursday.
articles.byline: By Christine Haughney and David Carr

articles.headline: Seized by Rebels, Town Is Crushed by Syrian Forces
articles.snippet: Airstrikes sent up dust and rubble and crushed several dozen people who had returned to what they thought was a new haven in a country mired in civil war, witnesses said.
articles.abstract: Airstrikes sent up dust and rubble and crushed several dozen people who had returned to what they thought was a new haven in a country mired in civil war, witnesses said.
articles.lead_paragraph: BEIRUT, Lebanon — The town of Maarat al-Noaman in northern Syria was just last week the scene of a major victory for the insurgents, who drove government forces from checkpoints at a crucial crossroads on a major highway, apprehended scores of soldiers, celebrated atop captured armored vehicles and declared the town “liberated.”
articles.byline: By Anne Barnard and Hwaida Saad
